nba.agents package¶

Submodules¶

nba.agents.agent module¶

class nba.agents.agent.NBAAgent(db=True, safe=True)¶

Bases: object

Base class to perform script-like tasks Use subclasses to replace standalone scripts so can use common API and tools Would be helpful to map a bunch of generic actions so don’t need to remember composed parts Example: instead of self.nbadb.insert it would be self.insert, which handles the necessary internal plumbing for you

read_file(fname)¶

Pass filename, it returns datastructure. Decides based on file extension.

save_file(data, fname)¶

Pass filename, it returns datastructure. Decides based on file extension.

website(webdir)¶

Generates static website to upload to S3 bucket This needs to be rewritten generically to create pages of tables from a list of dictionaries

nba.agents.fantasylabs module¶

class nba.agents.fantasylabs.FantasyLabsNBAAgent(db=False, safe=True, use_cache=True)¶

Bases: nba.agents.agent.NBAAgent

Performs script-like tasks using fantasylabs scraper, parser, and db module Intended to replace standalone scripts so can use common API and tools

Examples

a = FantasyLabsNBAAgent() players = a.today_models() players, pp_players = a.today_models()

past_day_models(model_day, model_name='default', fn=None, insert_db=False)¶

Gets list of player models for day

Parameters:
  • model_day (str) – in %Y-%m-%d format
  • model_name (str) – default, cash, etc.
  • fn (str) – name of model json file to load from disk
  • insert_db (bool) – true if want to insert models into database
Returns:

players – parsed model pp_players (list): parsed model, prepared for insert into database
Return type:

list
range_models(range_start, range_end, model_name='default', insert_db=False)¶

Gets list of player models for day

Parameters:
  • range_start (str) – in %Y-%m-%d format
  • range_end (str) – in %Y-%m-%d format
  • model_name (str) – default, cash, etc.
  • fn (str) – name of model json file to load from disk
  • insert_db (bool) – true if want to insert models into database
Returns:

players – parsed model pp_players (list): parsed model, prepared for insert into database
Return type:

list
today_models(model_name='default', fn=None, insert_db=False)¶

Gets list of player models for today’s games

Parameters:
  • model_name (str) – default, cash, etc.
  • fn (str) – name of model json file to load from disk
  • insert_db (bool) – true if want to insert models into database
Returns:

players – parsed model pp_players (list): parsed model, prepared for insert into database

nba.agents.nbacom module¶

class nba.agents.nbacom.NBAComAgent(db=True, safe=True)¶

Bases: nba.agents.agent.NBAAgent

Performs script-like tasks using NBA.com API Intended to replace standalone scripts so can use common API and tools

Examples

a = NBAComAgent() gamelogs = a.cs_player_gamelogs(‘2015-16’)

combine_boxscores(boxes, advanced_boxes)¶

processes result from calling NBAComScraper.boxscores() and boxscores_advanced()

Parameters:
  • boxscores (list) – list of ‘base’ boxscores
  • boxscores – list of ‘advanced’ boxscores
Returns:

merged_players(list) merged_teams(list)
commonallplayers(season)¶

Solves problem of players changing teams nba.com updates player teams regularly, so i look every day to make sure lists accurate

cs_player_gamelogs(season, date_from=None, date_to=None)¶

Fetches player_gamelogs and updates cs_player_gamelogs table

Parameters:season (str) – in YYYY-YY format (2015-16)
Returns:players – player dictionary of stats + dfs points
Return type:list
cs_playerstats(season, date_from=None, date_to=None)¶

Fetches cs_player_stats and updates database table

Parameters:
  • season (str) – in YYYY-YY format (2015-16)
  • date_from (str) – in %Y-%m-%d format, default beginning of season
  • date_from – in %Y-%m-%d format, default yesterday
Returns:

player_stats – player dictionary of basic and advanced stats
Return type:

list
cs_team_gamelogs(season, date_from=None, date_to=None)¶

Fetches team_gamelogs and updates cs_team_gamelogs table

Parameters:season (str) – in YYYY-YY format (2015-16)
Returns:team_gl – player dictionary of stats
Return type:list

Fetches leaguedashteamstats and updates cs_leaguedashteamstats table

  • date_from (str) – in %Y-%m-%d format, default beginning of season
  • date_from – in %Y-%m-%d format, default yesterday
Returns:

teamstats – team dictionary of basic and advanced stats
Return type:

list
merge_boxes(b1, b2)¶

Base and player advanced boxscores from same game

Parameters:
  • base_box (dict) – base boxscore
  • adv_box (dict) – advanced boxscore
Returns:

merged(dict) or None
players_to_add()¶

TODO: Adapt to postgres Purpose is to compare current_season_gamelogs and players tables to see if missing players in latter

scoreboards(season_start, season_end, pkl_fname=None)¶

Downloads and parses range of scoreboards, optionally saves to pickle file

teamgames(games)¶

Converts list of games into list in teamgames format, where there are2 teamgames for every game

Parameters:games (list) – list of games from nba.com where two teams are in 1 row (visitor, home)
Returns:teamgames – list of games in teamgames format, 2 teamgames per game row
Return type:list
Usage:

# is in format {‘game_id’, ‘visitor_team_id’, ‘home_team_id’, . . . } games = NBAPostgres.select_dict(‘SELECT * FROM games’)

# is in format {‘game_id’, ‘team_id’, ‘opponent_team_id’, ‘is_home’ . . . } teamgames = NBAComAgent.teamgames(games)

nba.agents.rotoguru module¶

class nba.agents.rotoguru.RotoguruNBAAgent(**kwargs)¶

Bases: nba.agents.agent.NBAAgent

Performs script-like tasks using rotoguru scraper and parser Intended to replace standalone scripts so can use common API and tools

Examples

a = RotoguruNBAAgent()

rg_salaries(salary_pages, players_fname, site)¶

Parses list of rotoguru pages into list of salary dictionaries

Parameters:
  • salary_pages (dict) – keyed by gamedate, value is HTML
  • players_fname (str) – is full path of csv file with players
  • site (str) – name of site - dk, fd, yh . . .
Returns:

salaries – list of salary dictionaries players (dict): keys are player name, values are player id unmatched (defaultdict): keys are playername, values is counter
Return type:

list
Usage:
salaries = NBAComAgent.rotoguru_dfs_salaries(salary_pages, ‘~/players.csv’, ‘dk’) NBAComAgent.nbadb.insert_dicts(salaries, ‘salaries’)
